page.title: 16River Wharfe
page.content: {The River Wharfe}rises very quickly, though it rarely causes disruption on the roads in mid-Wharfedale. The{fish}in the river include naturally bred game fish and fish introduced from breeding pools at {Barden.}Permits to fish are expensive. {The Strid,}at grid ref. 04070456, is a very narrow and very deep rock channel of the river, and very dangerous. When in spate it is not as dangerous as when low, ref. Wordsworth's poem "The White Doe of Rylestone". The river is a popular{tourist}attraction. There are specially laid out{Nature Trails along its banks, through Strid Wood, and public footpaths on both sides. There is only a litle pollution from farm effluent now.
